DataElement.preferredName: Provider Primary Care Enrolled Study Subject Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: indicatior related to providing primary care to an enrolled participant for eligibility

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Provider Primary Care Enrolled Study Subject Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: One that makes something available._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria._Health services that meet most basic health care needs over time. Primary care includes physical exams, treatment of common medical conditions, and preventive care such as immunizations and screenings. Primary care doctors are usually the first health professionals patients see for basic medical care. They may refer a patient to a specialist if needed._Status assigned to a subject who agrees to participate in a study,  following completion of the informed consent process and meeting inclusion criteria. NOTE: Enrollment routinely requires verification of eligibility and inclusion in the analysis database. [after Clinicaltrials.gov]. NOTE: A less common definition assigns enrolled status is the point of enrollment, Can be defined from the signing of an informed consent form. Other ways of defining enrollment or subject status can be specified in some protocols, e.g. non-interventional studies. See also informed consent.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: One who supplies a means of subsistence; one that makes something, such as a service, available, e.g. health care provider.

Property.preferredName: Primary Care Study Subject Enrolled Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Health services that meet most basic health care needs over time. Primary care includes physical exams, treatment of common medical conditions, and preventive care such as immunizations and screenings. Primary care doctors are usually the first health professionals patients see for basic medical care. They may refer a patient to a specialist if needed.:Status assigned to a subject who agrees to participate in a study,  following completion of the informed consent process and meeting inclusion criteria. NOTE: Enrollment routinely requires verification of eligibility and inclusion in the analysis database. [after Clinicaltrials.gov]. NOTE: A less common definition assigns enrolled status is the point of enrollment, Can be defined from the signing of an informed consent form. Other ways of defining enrollment or subject status can be specified in some protocols, e.g. non-interventional studies. See also informed consent.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Health services that meet most basic health care needs over time. Primary care includes physical exams, treatment of common medical conditions, and preventive care such as immunizations and screenings. Primary care doctors are usually the first health professionals patients see for basic medical care. They may refer a patient to a specialist if needed.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
